title: Jayson Tatum remains noncommittal about returning this season for Celtics
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a practice with the Maine Celtics but remains noncommittal about returning this NBA season.
Tatum is recovering from an Achilles tendon injury sustained in May 2025; he describes the process as mentally exhausting.
The Celtics, without Tatum, are tied for second place in the Eastern Conference with a 34-19 record this season.

title: Mass. Education Secretary Patrick Tutwiler to step down in latest departure from Healey cabinet
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Patrick Tutwiler will step down as Massachusetts Education Secretary to lead Walker Therapeutic & Educational Programs.
Salem Schools Superintendent Stephen Zrike will replace Tutwiler as Massachusetts Education Secretary in March.
Tutwiler's tenure included the controversial removal of MCAS as a graduation requirement and early literacy funding initiatives.

title: Drake Maye says marrying young was ‘one of the best things I’ve experienced in my life’
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Patriots quarterback Drake Maye shared he married Ann Michael in June 2025 after dating since middle school.
Maye expressed no regrets about marrying young in an Instagram post with ESPN, calling it a significant life experience.
Maye's comments coincided with Super Bowl 60, where the Patriots lost to the Seattle Seahawks in Santa Clara, California.

title: 23 queer romance books perfect for Valentine’s Day reading
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: The queer romance matrix categorizes 23 novels by spice level and tone for Valentine's Day reading.
The matrix includes genres like gothic, historical, and contemporary, with themes ranging from sweet first love to intense romance.
The guide is inspired by New York Magazine's Approval Matrix and aims to assist romantically inclined, online readers.

title: Will Campbell talks poor Super Bowl performance, avoiding media, and more
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Will Campbell apologized for declining media interviews after Patriots' 29-13 loss in Super Bowl LX.
Campbell struggled during the game, allowing 14 QB pressures, the highest by any player this season.
Despite struggles, Patriots' coach Mike Vrabel confirmed Campbell would remain the team's left tackle.

title: Mike Vrabel on the Patriots’ foundation, his view of the 2025 season, and Will Campbell’s future
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel praised the team's foundation after a 14-3 season and Super Bowl LX loss to Seahawks.
Vrabel confirmed Will Campbell will remain left tackle despite criticism, rejecting pre-draft notions of moving him to guard.
Defensive coordinator Terrell Williams will return in 2026 following prostate cancer recovery, with Zak Kuhr's role under consideration.

title: Boston to host FIFA World Cup Fan Fest at City Hall Plaza
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Boston will host the FIFA World Cup Fan Fest at City Hall Plaza, announced by Mayor Michelle Wu and Gov. Maura Healey.
The festival aims to showcase Boston's culture and support local businesses, featuring live entertainment and local food.
The event coincides with seven World Cup matches at Gillette Stadium, expected to generate $100 million in tax revenue.

title: Are MBTA commuters destined to suffer for the rest of the winter?
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: MBTA faces delays and cancellations due to snowstorms, with frigid temperatures affecting operations across Greater Boston.
General Manager Phil Eng promises improvements, stating that efforts are underway to address weather-related transit issues.
Red Line's older cars remain in service to meet demand, while new solutions like crib heaters are being implemented.

title: Wu says she would vote for statewide rent control through proposed ballot question
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Mayor Michelle Wu supports statewide rent control, despite preferring a local option, due to rising housing costs.
The proposed ballot measure ties rent increases to cost of living with a 5% annual cap, excluding certain buildings.
Massachusetts needs another 12,429 signatures for the measure to appear on the November ballot if Legislature doesn't act.

title: Christian Gonzalez on Patriots extension talks: ‘I don’t want to be anywhere else’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Christian Gonzalez is open to a contract extension with the New England Patriots during the 2026 offseason.
Gonzalez, 23, is entering the final year of his rookie contract but the Patriots can extend it via a fifth-year option.
Fellow cornerback Carlton Davis supports an extension, calling Gonzalez one of the best corners in the league.
